glsa.title: Lua: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in Lua might allow context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Lua is a powerful, efficient, lightweight, embeddable scripting language. It supports procedural programming, object-oriented programming, functional programming, data-driven programming, and data description.

description.p: A buffer overflow was discovered in the vararg functions in ldo.c in Lua.

impact.p: Context-dependent could cause a Denial of Service condition or execute arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Lua users should upgrade to the latest version:
